intro: Astrantia neglecta, commonly known as the lesser dropwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, featuring basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in spherical clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Astrantia neglecta is often found in damp soils and is considered a valuable plant for wetland restoration projects.
